properties.Event: Crawford plan for Bombay Development
properties.Importance: An early plan to improve sanitation throughout the city was lost to a change of leadership

properties.Event: Millworkers' Association Established
properties.Importance: Organization of millworkers to fight against British taxes and tariffs

properties.Event: Formation of Indian National Congress
properties.Importance: First large and national group to be formed to oppose colonial rule

properties.Event: First meeting of Indian National Congress
properties.Importance: Representative from every region came to discuss how to end colonialism

properties.Event: Bombay Municipal Act
properties.Importance: British now have more power of city affairs

properties.Event: Plague breaks out
properties.Importance: Health crisis

properties.Event: First case of bulbonic plague identified by Dr. Acacio Gabriel Viegas
properties.Importance: 22 per 1000 people died because of the plague (TB+cholera caused 26 per 1000 deaths)

properties.Event: Executive order to isolate all persons suspected of having the disease
properties.Importance: Top-down decree stating that government has control over the people for their own "good"

properties.Event: Plague Committee of doctors established
properties.Importance: Take a culturally and socially disconnected view of how to proceed

properties.Event: Sanitation blamed for spread of the plague
properties.Importance: Plague committee of British and Indian doctors determined that sanitation issues in the city are at the root of the problem.

properties.Event: People leave at a rate of 1,900 a week
properties.Importance: Initially, this is a good thing because it alleviates over crowding

properties.Event: The health department begins police searches to find infected individuals and control the plague
properties.Importance: Government enacts their power over the people to protect the public and themselves

properties.Event: Millworkers in particular live in cramped and congested housing and are leaving the city
properties.Importance: Millworkers were disproportionately affected, and disproportionately tried to leave the city

properties.Event: Plague disproporitonately affects millworkers
properties.Importance: Factories cannot find people to work in them

properties.Event: Epidemic Diseases Act gives authorities right to inspect, disinfect and demolish private homes
properties.Importance: Top-down use of force for a health concern

properties.Event: Strike at Cotton Green protesting forced police searches
properties.Importance: Public pushes back on government tactics

properties.Event: Commissioner Snow's report identifies sanitation as a primary cause of the plague
properties.Importance: Confirmation that sanitation is the usse

properties.Event: Scavengers, sanitation workers and other service workers barred from leaving the city
properties.Importance: Lower classes are trapped in the city to continue to do sanitation work

properties.Event: Second Plague committee established to address sanitatoin
properties.Importance: This committee was government oriented, not health

properties.Event: Riots in response to government's strategy for dealing with the plague
properties.Importance: Government officials were forcibly removing people from their homes, destroying neighborhoods in order to "Sanitize" areas

properties.Event: Bombay City Improvement Trust established
properties.Importance: Established to "improve" sanitation and quality of life in Bombay, a government body, they are given control over development projects and the right to destroy insanitary housing

properties.Event: The Dadar-Matunga-Wadala-Sion scheme proposed
properties.Importance: Organized housing plan by colonial powers in a top-down decree.

properties.Event: Neighborhoods destroyed in the name of "sanitation"
properties.Importance: Mostly poor and working class areas, further contributing to the housing crisis

properties.Event: Many people move to Dharavi and other informal settlements in the city
Mills and railways seriously impacted by loss of workers
Over 500,000 people left the city (approximately 25% of all millworkers)
Most people have returned to find work, and the plague has subsided
